name: ControlStatementBraces
summary:
Enforce a policy for braces on control statements. It is recommended to use braces on 'if ... else'
statements and loop statements, even if they are optional. This usually makes the code clearer, and
helps prepare the future when you need to add another statement. That said, this rule lets you control
which statements are required to have braces via properties.

From 6.2.0 on, this rule supersedes WhileLoopMustUseBraces, ForLoopMustUseBraces, IfStmtMustUseBraces,
and IfElseStmtMustUseBraces.

configuration.name: checkIfElseStmt
configuration.description: Require that 'if ... else' statements use braces

configuration.name: checkSingleIfStmt
configuration.description: Require that 'if' statements with a single branch use braces

configuration.name: checkForStmt
configuration.description: Require that 'for' loops should use braces

configuration.name: checkDoWhileStmt
configuration.description: Require that 'do ... while' loops use braces

configuration.name: checkCaseStmt
configuration.description: Require that cases of a switch have braces

configuration.name: allowEmptyLoop
configuration.description: Allow loops with an empty statement, e.g. 'while(true);'
